On 10/29/12 9:51 AM, Coram, Roger wrote:
> We're nearing the end of a fairly lengthy crawl and have just
> discovered that our 'state' directory is full (and of course, didn't
> have a DiskSpaceMonitor present).
>
> Obviously each of the crawlers has thrown errors and while I used the
> REST API to try and pause each of the crawlers but I'm not certain
> whether that's worked; the web interface for each of the crawlers is
> unresponsive.
>
> I'm just wondering whether this is something Heritrix is likely to
> recover from itself (or even capable of doing such)? Or is it a
> matter of attempting recovery for each crawler?
>
> Thanks, Roger

In general Heritrix and the BerkeleyDB-JE library don't handle disk-full 
errors gracefully, because writes-that-must-succeed happen deep in many 
operations that can't be easily held-and-retried after some 
arbitrarily-later disk cleanup.

A /state/ directory that's failed to take in-process writes is 
essentially corrupt. You'd want to rollback to a previously-valid 
state... either starting fresh or from a cleanly-completely prior 
checkpoint.

So it is essentially a restart-and-recover situation.

- Gordon
